recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.recipe:
1. Boil spaghetti until al dente. 
2. In a separate pan, cook pancetta until crispy. 
3. Whisk eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper in a bowl. 
4. Drain spaghetti, add to the pancetta pan, and toss. 
5. Remove from heat and quickly stir in egg mixture. 
6. Serve with additional cheese and black pepper.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo
recipes.recipe:
1. Cook fettuccine according to package instructions. 
2. Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then grill or pan-sear until cooked. 
3. In a saucepan, melt butter, add minced garlic and heavy cream, and simmer. 
4. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until sauce thickens. 
5. Slice chicken and serve over cooked fettuccine with Alfredo sauce.

recipes.name: Caesar Salad
recipes.recipe:
1. Tear Romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces. 
2. In a bowl, mix together mayonnaise, lemon juice, anchovy paste, Worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, and grated Parmesan cheese. 
3. Toss the dressing with lettuce, croutons, and grated Parmesan. 
4. Serve with optional grilled chicken or shrimp.

recipes.name: Beef Stir-Fry
recipes.recipe:
1. Slice beef thinly and marinate with soy sauce, ginger, and garlic. 
2. Heat oil in a wok or skillet, stir-fry beef until browned. 
3. Remove beef and stir-fry vegetables until tender-crisp. 
4. Return beef to the wok, add oyster sauce, and toss. 
5. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)

recipes.name: Caprese Salad
recipes.recipe:
1. Slice ripe tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese. 
2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate. 
3. Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and balsamic glaze. 
4. Season with salt, pepper, and fresh basil leaves. 
5. Serve immediately as a side dish or appetizer.

recipes.name: Pasta Primavera
recipes.recipe:
1. Cook pasta until al dente. 
2. Sauté garlic and a variety of fresh vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, zucchini, cherry tomatoes) in olive oil. 
3. Toss cooked pasta with sautéed vegetables. 
4. Drizzle with lemon juice, sprinkle with grated Parmesan, and garnish with fresh herbs.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy. 
3. Beat in eggs and vanilla. 
4. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt. 
5. Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet mixture. 
6. Stir in chocolate chips. 
7. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet. 
8. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Greek Salad
recipes.recipe:
1. Combine chopped cucumbers, tomatoes, red onions, and Kalamata olives in a large bowl. 
2. Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and red wine vinegar. 
3. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper. 
4. Add crumbled feta cheese and toss gently. 
5. Serve chilled as a refreshing side dish.
